channel.title: Abouts on Marco Stefanucci
channel.description: Recent content in Abouts on Marco Stefanucci

item.title: Little Bio
item.description: I am a postdoctoral researcher in Statistics at University of Padova. I obtained my PhD at University of Rome - La Sapienza under the supervision of professor Pierpaolo Brutti. During and after my PhD I had the chance to collaborate with other researchers, such as David Kraus, Laura Sangalli and Antonio Canale. Currently I am working (together with Stefano Mazzuco from University of Padova) on applying functional data analysis to demographic data in order to discover patterns among countries.

item.title: Essential CV
item.description: Contacts Email: marco.stefanuc@gmail.com Current position [2019+] Post Doctoral researcher Department of Statistical Sciences, University of Padua Past positions [2018-2019] Post Dosctoral researcher Department of Statistical Sciences, University of Padua Education [2015-2018] PhD in Methodological Statistics Department of Statistical Sciences, University of Rome - La Sapienza [2012-2015] Master of Science in Statistics Department of Statistical Sciences, University of Rome - La Sapienza [2009-2012] Bachelor in Statistics Department of Statistical Sciences, University of Rome - La Sapienza

item.title: My Collaborators
item.description: I’ve shared pain and gain with some other researchers in statistics-related fields, most of them are listed here. Pierpaolo Brutti, associate professor at University of Rome - La Sapienza Antonio Canale, associate professor at University of Padua David Kraus, assistant professor at Masaryk University, Brno Stefano Mazzuco, associate professor at University of Padua Laura Sangalli, associate professor at Polictecnico di Milano
